com.soa.message.handler
Interface HandlerContext

All Known Subinterfaces:
WSDLHandlerContext
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultHandlerContext
public interface HandlerContext

Provides a HandlerFactory some context about the framework from where any constructed MessageHandler will be used. For example, HanderUnitManager implementations can be registered through this context so that handler can possibly have different implementation logic for different scopes.

When chains of handlers are created, the HandlerFactories are also called in a chain. To allow HandlerFactories to establish their own context to be used by other factories a properties capability is provided. The properties set by one factory is available to all subsequently called factories.

Since:
3.1

Method Detail

getProperty

java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String name)
Returns the property with the given name.

Parameters:
name - Name of the property.
Returns:
Object holding the value of the requested property, null if none found.

setProperty

void setProperty(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Object property)
Adds or replaces a property.

Parameters:
name - Name of the property.
property - Value of the property.

getPropertyNames

java.util.Set getPropertyNames()
Returns the names of the properties associated with the context. Changes made to the Set are reflected in the context, so if a name is removed from the Set, the property is removed from the context. Names cannot be added however.

Returns:
Set of String property names.
